question_title: What will be Namibia's annual inflation rate for March 2026?
summary: Namibia's March 2026 annual inflation is forecast to be around 3.4%, with significant uncertainty. Key factors: (1) December 2025 inflation at 3.2% (lowest in 2025), (2) favorable base effect from elevated March 2025 (4.2%), (3) Bank of Namibia forecasts 3.8-4.3% average for 2026, (4) South Africa inflation expected ~3% (currency peg). The base effect from high March 2025 will compress YoY rates, but modest uptick expected through 2026. Distribution is slightly right-skewed for supply shock risks.

factors.description: December 2025 inflation at 3.2% - lowest point in 2025, indicates declining trend
Favorable base effect: March 2025 was elevated at 4.2%, making YoY comparison easier
Bank of Namibia forecasts 3.8-4.3% average for 2026 - expect uptick from current lows
South Africa inflation expected ~3% in 2026 (currency peg creates anchor)
Food inflation was elevated in mid-2025 (5.8%) - could resurge
Services inflation trending higher (4.0% in Dec 2025 vs 3.9% prior year)
